conclusion: The problem involves determining the direction of wave propagation and the wave speed based on the given waveforms.
Figure 1 shows a transverse harmonic wave along the x-axis with a wavelength of 4 meters and an amplitude of 10 cm.
Figure 2 shows the vibration of the particle at x = 2 m as a function of time, with an amplitude of 10 cm.
The wave amplitude is 10 cm, and the wavelength is 4 meters.
The position of the particle at x = 2 m is shown at t = 2 s.

premise: The wavelength λ = 4 m and the time interval Δt = 2 s.
conclusion: The wave speed v = λ / Δt = 4 m / 2 s = 2 m/s.

premise: The wave is traveling from left to right as stated in the solution.
conclusion: The direction of wave propagation is from left to right.

premise: The wave speed is calculated as 2 m/s.
conclusion: The wave speed is 2 meters per second.

premise: The solution concludes the wave speed and direction.
